716: In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next! When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for. Job Description: Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Military Forces Intelligence Analyst to join our team! In this role you will get to analyze military forces order of battle and update the modernized integrated database (MIDB). What You'll Be Doing: Analyze intelligence message traffic for items related to order of battle. Conduct analysis to determine if a record for identified items exist, then take action to create a new record or update existing record. Apply knowledge of foreign military capabilities, particularly in the INDOPACOM or EUCOM region, to establish military order of battle structures and equipment. Support a rotation to the Russia-Ukraine crisis team. What Required Skills You'll Bring: Bachelor's degree and 3 years of relevant experience or HS Diploma/GED and 7 years of relevant experience. Experience using MIDB. Knowledge of DoD, IC, and INDOPACOM or EUCOM. Ability to support shift work for the Russia-Ukraine crisis team, if needed. What Desired Skills You'll Bring: 4+ years of experience as a strategic all-source intelligence analyst. 1+ years of experience in the EUCOM AOR. Knowledge of the intelligence cycle. Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, including briefing and a willingness to learn. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Top Secret SCI w/Polygraph This position is part of our Federal Solutions team. Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now. Salary Range: $68,400.00 - $119,700.00 The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.
